intro: Calesiam fruticosum, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
